intro: Phalangium scilloides, commonly known as the silverleaf phalangium, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has silvery-gray foliage that reflects sunlight, aiding in water conservation. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
